intro: Larsenaikia ochreata, commonly known as the ochre daisy, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its bright yellow ray florets and dark brown central disk, which give it a striking appearance. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and thrives in full sun, exhibiting drought tolerance. Its small, narrow leaves are arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its compact growth habit. Larsenaikia ochreata is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in low-water conditions.
